author: Alex Brown
text:
According to the U.S. Treasury Department the federal government will run up against its current debt limit of $14.3 trillion by May 16. The attached letter from Treasury Secretary Geithner to Speaker Boehner describes steps that the Treasury Department will take if the ceiling is not raised, including the suspension of the issuance of State and Local Government Securities on May 6th (due to issuance requirements). 
If the debt ceiling is not raised in the short term, how do you expect it will impact the financial policy of your local government?
title: Debt Ceiling Negotiations: Impact on Local Governments
